segment.source: Computers running Active Directory Certificate Services are members of this group.
segment.target: Computers running Active Directory Certificate Services are members of this group.

segment.source: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_SCHEMA_ADMINS
segment.target: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_SCHEMA_ADMINS

segment.source: The schema administrators' group.
segment.target: The schema administrators' group.

segment.source: Members of this group can modify the Active Directory schema.
segment.target: Members of this group can modify the Active Directory schema.

segment.source: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_ENTERPRISE_ADMINS
segment.target: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_ENTERPRISE_ADMINS

segment.source: The enterprise administrators' group.
segment.target: The enterprise administrators' group.

segment.source: Members of this group have full access to all domains in the Active Directory forest.
segment.target: Members of this group have full access to all domains in the Active Directory forest.

segment.source: Enterprise administrators are responsible for forest-level operations such as adding or removing new domains.
segment.target: Enterprise administrators are responsible for forest-level operations such as adding or removing new domains.

segment.source: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_POLICY_ADMINS
segment.target: DOMAIN_GROUP_RID_POLICY_ADMINS

segment.source: The policy administrators' group.
segment.target: The policy administrators' group.

segment.source: The following table provides examples of domain-relative RIDs that are used to form well-known SIDs for local groups.
segment.target: The following table provides examples of domain-relative RIDs that are used to form well-known SIDs for local groups.

segment.source: RID
segment.target: RID

segment.source: Identifies
segment.target: Identifies

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_ADMINS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_ADMINS

segment.source: Administrators of the domain.
segment.target: Administrators of the domain.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_USERS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_USERS

segment.source: All users in the domain.
segment.target: All users in the domain.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_GUESTS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_GUESTS

segment.source: Guests of the domain.
segment.target: Guests of the domain.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_POWER_USERS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_POWER_USERS

segment.source: A user or a set of users who expect to treat a system as if it were their personal computer rather than as a workstation for multiple users.
segment.target: A user or a set of users who expect to treat a system as if it were their personal computer rather than as a workstation for multiple users.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_BACKUP_OPS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_BACKUP_OPS

segment.source: A local group that is used to control the assignment of file backup-and-restore user rights.
segment.target: A local group that is used to control the assignment of file backup-and-restore user rights.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_REPLICATOR
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_REPLICATOR

segment.source: A local group that is responsible for copying security databases from the primary domain controller to the backup domain controllers.
segment.target: A local group that is responsible for copying security databases from the primary domain controller to the backup domain controllers.

segment.source: These accounts are used only by the system.
segment.target: These accounts are used only by the system.

segment.source: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_RAS_SERVERS
segment.target: DOMAIN_ALIAS_RID_RAS_SERVERS

segment.source: A local group that represents remote access and servers running Internet Authentication Service (IAS).
segment.target: A local group that represents remote access and servers running Internet Authentication Service (IAS).

segment.source: This group permits access to various attributes of User objects.
segment.target: This group permits access to various attributes of User objects.

segment.source: Changes in security identifier's functionality
segment.target: Changes in security identifier's functionality

segment.source: The following table describes changes in SID implementation in the Windows operating systems that are designated in the list.
segment.target: The following table describes changes in SID implementation in the Windows operating systems that are designated in the list.

segment.source: Change
segment.target: Change

segment.source: Operating system version
segment.target: Operating system version

segment.source: Description and resources
segment.target: Description and resources

segment.source: Most of the operating system files are owned by the TrustedInstaller security identifier (SID)
segment.target: Most of the operating system files are owned by the TrustedInstaller security identifier (SID)

segment.source: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista
segment.target: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista

segment.source: The purpose of this change is to prevent a process that is running as an administrator or under the LocalSystem account from automatically replacing the operating system files.
segment.target: The purpose of this change is to prevent a process that is running as an administrator or under the LocalSystem account from automatically replacing the operating system files.

segment.source: Restricted SID checks are implemented
segment.target: Restricted SID checks are implemented

segment.source: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista
segment.target: Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista

segment.source: When restricting SIDs are present, Windows performs two access checks.
segment.target: When restricting SIDs are present, Windows performs two access checks.

segment.source: The first is the normal access check, and the second is the same access check against the restricting SIDs in the token.
segment.target: The first is the normal access check, and the second is the same access check against the restricting SIDs in the token.

segment.source: Both access checks must pass to allow the process to access the object.
segment.target: Both access checks must pass to allow the process to access the object.

segment.target: See also

segment.target: Access Control Overview
